title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response that equates x P (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB4@ with v P (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB2@ does not earn the point.

An unlabeled response earns the point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Earning the first point is not necessary for a response to be eligible to earn the second or third points; however, the response must present an expression for a Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D9E@ to be eligible for third point.

A response earns the second point with either of the following statements: “ v Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DA3@ and a Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D9E@ have opposite signs” or “ v Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DA3@ and a Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D9E@ have the same sign.” This statement, however, must be consistent with v Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DA3@ and the presented expression for a Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D9E@ .

A response must earn the second point to be eligible for the third point. The answer must be consistent with the presented justification. Furthermore, responses for which a Q (t)>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F60@ for t>0  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFB@ must conclude that there is no time at which the speed of the particle is decreasing.

A response that indicates v Q  ( t )<0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40D4@ does not earn the third point, even if the answer and justification are consistent with a reported sign of a Q (t). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF2@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response that presents ∫ 1 t 1 t 2  dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43E2@ (using the same variable as a limit and integrand function) does not earn the first point unless it is followed by an attempt at integration.

A response that presents either ∫ 1 t 2  dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4153@ or − 1 t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C0B@ (with no integral) earns the first point. If the response continues and presents 2=−1+C, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EE0@ then the response earns the second point.

A response that presents only y Q (t)=− 1 t +3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@434A@ will earn all 3 points. Note that the right side of this equation suffices to earn all points. A response of y Q (t)=− 1 t +C, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4405@ where C≠3, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D18@ (with no additional supporting work) earns only the first point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response with an incorrect y Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D57@ from part (c) is eligible for both points in part (d) provided y Q (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D57@ is a non-constant function. The second point is earned for a consistent answer with reason, and limits correct for particle P and the presented y Q (t). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E09@

Responses that present statements such as “ 6−4 e −t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA3@ approaches 6” or “Q goes to 3” earn the first point and are eligible for the second point.

A response that treats ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaajaaWqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabg6HiLcaa@3B56@ as an input for x P (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB4@ or y Q  ( t ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4046@ such as “ 6−4 e − ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@428A@ ” or “ 3− 1 ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E09@ ” is not eligible for the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
